alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 1:43PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...A Strong Storm Moves Through the Panhandle This Weekend... A gale force low with a significant source of subtropical moisture will enter the Gulf of Alaska Saturday. Heaviest rainfall is expected Saturday afternoon and into the evening. By Sunday, the plume of moisture becomes directed at the NE Gulf Coast while the southern two thirds of the Panhandle sees less precipitation. Estimates indicate high confidence in widespread 2 to 3 inches of rain falling from Saturday morning to early Sunday morning with locally higher amounts possible. From the this heavy precipitation, expect to see rapid rises in small rivers and creeks but at this time they will remain within their banks. This front will also bring windy conditions to Southeast communities. Sustained winds between 15 to 25 mph with periods of high gusts to 30 to 40 mph are likely. Expected the strongest winds Saturday.
